snippet: A current employee of the Human Resources Administration, along with one who had been fired and 11 others, were charged with wire fraud and conspiracy to commit mail fraud.
abstract: New York City Human Resources Administration employee Cherrise Watson-Jackson and former employee Petronila Peralta are arrested and charged with stealing $2.1 million from number of government benefit programs; eleven others are also charged in case, which authorities describe as elaborate fraud scheme; separately, city's Dept of Investigation releases report identifying past fraud schemes perpetrated by other administration employees.

byline.original: By BENJAMIN MUELLER and NIKITA STEWART
byline.contributor: Noah Remnick and John Surico contributed reporting, and Jack Begg contributed research.

lead_paragraph: A current employee of the Human Resources Administration, along with one who had been fired and 11 others, were charged with wire fraud and conspiracy to commit mail fraud.

headline.main: Two New York City Workers Charged With Stealing $2.1 Million From Benefits Programs
headline.print_headline: 2 City Workers Charged With Stealing $2.1 Million From Benefits Programs
